shortDescription: We have an extremely odd assignment for you. We have a manufacturing facility on the planet below, and we've been aware that {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Demonym} forces have been scouting in the area. We've expected them to make a move, but we didn't expect them to... send us a warning beforehand? Apparently they've hired a mercenary who contacted us to let us know when the attack would be, because, and I'm quoting, "professional ethics." We have no idea what that means.
longDescription: Why would anyone give their target a warning? And what the hell does 'professional ethics' mean? This is bizarre.

objectiveList.title: Defend Target Buildings
objectiveList.description: Defend Targeted Base Structures from Attackers

objectiveList.title: Destroy the Enemy Vanguard
objectiveList.description: Destroy the enemy vanguard force, the first wave.

objectiveList.title: All target buildings must survive
objectiveList.description: Optional objective to keep ALL target structures intact.

objectiveList.title: Hold Out for Reinforcements
objectiveList.description: Objective for tracking the time left in the mission. While the player it told to Hold Out for Reinforcements

objectiveList.title: Escort Engineer APCs to Base Defenses
objectiveList.description: Escort Engineer APCs to Base Defenses in order to take control of them.

objectiveList.title: Hidden Objective: Destroy the Second Lance
objectiveList.description: Hidden Objective: Destroy the Second Lance

objectiveList.title: Hidden Objective: Destroy the Third Lance
objectiveList.description: Hidden Objective: Destroy the Third Lance

dialogueContent.words: The manufacturing facility is just up ahead. Meyer, any sign of our polite opposition?
I'm seeing... uh, I'm seeing a lot of engine signatures out there, XO.
I gave you plenty of time to prepare. Did you think I wouldn't prepare as well?
I don't get it. What's the point of this?
To prove which of us is better: your whole company... or me.
I suppose this means we're the better mercenaries, though I'm not sure why we needed to know that.
Indeed. One of these days I'll have to take the field against you personally.
That transmission is coming from a relay in orbit. They weren't even here, just remote piloting a 'Mech.
What a damn disaster. Let's debrief back in orbit.
Argo, my engineers are powering the turrets up now. The APCs will scatter and provide support.
Roger, local command. Commander, looks like we have a few more guns on our side.
Warning commander, sensors are reading multiple contacts approaching from multiple vectors. Looks like the attacking force has brought reinforcements.
Be advised, some of the target buildings are sustaining damage. Your mission is to keep them standing.
Commander, a target building has been demolished. Ensure the integrity of the remaining buildings.
My people only have one more building left to destroy. You're not going to at least try and make this a challenge for me?
Mercenary Commander, we've received word of the assault on your position. Reinforcements are incoming, they are about halfway there. Maintain position and you will be relieved and reinforced shortly.
Argo, this is {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Demonym} local command. Our turrets have been disabled by sabotage.
Well now there's a surprise.
That's going to make this mission rough, command. Suggestions?
I have a team of engineers that can manually restart the turrets, but that can only be done in person at turret control.
Roger. Commander, if we want any backup, we'll need to keep those APCs alive until they get to the turret control building.
